intro: Ruellia haenkeana var. haenkeana, commonly known as the Mexican bluebell, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or violet tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual or perennial herb, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs, while its stems are square in cross-section. Ruellia haenkeana var. haenkeana thrives in full sun to partial shade and is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens.
